text: ' is located in Ōta, Tokyo, Japan. It has 506 beds and is run by the Tokyo Metropolitan Health and Hospitals Corporation. As the hospital is located near Haneda Airport, it often provides treatment to those returning from abroad. It is specially equipped to handle infectious diseases. ==History== The hospital was established in July 1898. During the 2020 coronavirus pandemic, Ebara Hospital took in the first Japanese evacuees from Wuhan, China, who showed symptoms of the disease. The hospital has rooms with negative air pressure ventilation systems designed to prevent the spread of infectious diseases. ==Departments== ==See also== * List of hospitals in Japan ==References== ==External links== * Category:Hospitals established in 1898 Category:Hospitals in Tokyo
title: Ebara Hospital
